review:
A fun little puzzle game. The puzzles aren't particularly complex - each regular case has a 'gimmick' that you can easily figure out how to reliably solve once you understand it, but despite that the combinations in the randomly generated cases can make things surprisingly fun and it feels nice to manage to gather all the information in the nick of time.

The art style is simple, yet stylish and perfectly fitting for the 'classic murder mystery' kind of aesthetic they're going for, as are the various character lines when interrogating them.

For what it is, it's nothing fancy, but it's definitely a delightful little game if you're a fan of Cluedo. Best played in short bursts here and there when you're too tired for fast-paced games, or at least that's how I played it. Shame some of the achievements are nightmares to get, but that'll hardly affect your play.

Overall I enjoyed my time at the manor quite a bit, and I think I will continue to visit in the future! (If only to name my guests atrociously at my friends' behest.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016999980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1641496275}
review:
I love the art style, the music, and the humor. Right up my alley. However, the notebook UI is kinda clunky and counter-intuitive, and some of the repeated sound effects are jarring and extremely annoying.

Some of the levels have genuinely engaging puzzles that I truly enjoyed, but most of the levels are held back by the time limit; I feel like I'm just guessing and wasting time until I hit on a breakthrough (especially solving the weapons in many of the early levels) -- and if I hit that point too late, I literally can't solve the level in time.

It's kinda fun, but it's hard to engage with for long periods. If they ever come out with an updated version, I will *definitely* check it out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262374327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1655480740}
review:
This adorable, simplistic murder-mystery game is cleverly written and utilises Sherlock Holmes deductive reasoning. The game features an adorable and charming cast of Agatha Christie-esque characters that attend house parties and alternate between getting murdered or being the murderer. You play the role of the detective (and you can even give yourself a name and quirky title) and must solve the crime before the murderer gets away...or strikes again!

Each case takes only a few minutes to solve, and the variety of case-type, characters involved, mansion layouts, etc., allows for countless scenarios making each case feel fresh. There are 15 cases in the main game, each with a twist and getting a bit harder to solve each time, but after a couple of trial-and-error rounds, the difficulty of solving the later cases becomes almost non-existent. You can also auto-generate cases which randomises the case style, characters, location, weapon, etc., which keeps the game going even after beating all the main cases. However, the auto-generated cases aren't without a couple of bugs. I had a case get generated where an item was left behind in a certain room (which indicated a character was in that room no matter where they tell you they were at the time of the murder). A second character claimed they were in the room with this first character. Okay. A third character said he witnessed them in that room together, triply confirming they were in that room. However, this first character said they were somewhere else with someone else. This fourth character confirmed he was with the first character in this other location. Then a fifth character said they were in alone in the first room where there was already confirmation that there were at least two characters there...So who was where? Who was lying? I was unable to solve this case and had to generate a new one. Some other people have generated cases that are unsolvable which is bound to happen with the amount of variables involved, which is annoying, but the cases are short enough that it doesn't waste too much time having to reset to another case.

I do recommend this game. It's fun, quick gameplay allows it to work as a casual game, and it's problem-solving elements are not too difficult to pick up on. The game gives a you a notebook similar to Cluedo (or Clue) to check off weapons or suspects or motives to keep track of who's still a suspect, possible murder weapons, etc. The game also features very clever, humourous writing that keeps the game's tone light.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012111055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1512929737}
review:
De esas joyas ocultas que encuentras por casualidad. En mi caso estaba ojeando juegos que tuvieran mecánicas de investigación. Éste además usa generación procedural de casos, por lo que me interesó doblemente. 

Ojo: todo el juego está en inglés y por motivos obvios (es un juego basado en texto) es necesario dominar el idioma. 

Siendo sincero no esperaba mucho de él viendo los análisis: parecía una especie de cluedo con mecánicas sencillas. Y la verdad es que de eso se trata. Pero el conjunto está hecho de tal manera que resulta divertido y bastante satisfactorio. El juego tiene una serie de puzles que se combinan entre sí para crear casos específicos.

Cada caso mete a cinco sospechosos y un cadáver en una mansión. A partir de ahí tienes una cantidad limitada de turnos para averiguar quien ha sido el asesino. Puedes preguntar a cada implicado si tiene una cohartada, si sabe algo del arma del crimen y cuales son los motivos que podrían tener los demás invitados para matar a la víctima. 

Dependiendo el caso (o la generación del mismo) aparecen armas por la casa (consume tiempo revisarlas), puertas secretas u otros objetos que puedan darte pistas (o confundirte). Hay que fijarse en los textos (a veces hay pistas ocultas en ellos) o en la ausencia de cosas. 

El juego viene con 14 casos 'prefabricados' que intentan ser tutoriales ya que cada uno tiene una mecánica de puzzle específica sobre la que incide. A partir de ahi puedes jugar de forma indefinida con casos 'procedurales', en los que se mezclan mecánicas al azar.

Eso es A Matter of Murder.

review:
Maybe I'm just picky, but I find it difficult to find mystery video games I like. A Matter of Murder is one of those hidden gems and I adore it! It's very similar to Clue and Whodunnit's with several clever cases already made and the option to have a new case made for you, which gives it great replayability. Plus, there's nothing quite like the feeling of 'Oh, I'm so smart' after you've flawlessly solved a murder.

If you're a mystery fan and have been considering this game or just happened to stumble across this game, it's less than 3 dollars. Treat yo self.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995194702', 'num_games_owned': 1227, 'num_reviews': 714, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1507326880}
review:
Jen si to představte. Jste pozváni na párty do honosného sídla. Jenže jak se ukáže, celý večer se táhne jak lenochod přecházející silnici a vy se nudíte. A pak se to stane. Vraždička. Váš host je nalezen mrtev. Vy samou radostí poskočíte a řeknete si, proč tomu nezkusit přijít na kloub. Policie tu totiž bude až zhruba za hodinu a do té doby se vám může podařit odhalit vraha. Tak vzhůru do práce!

[h1]Vražda na večeři[/h1]
Hra A Matter of Murder se tedy odehrává v sídle, kde je společně s vámi pět dalších hostů. Jeden z nich je vrahem a vy máte 20 tahů na to, určit, kdo to je. Procházení se po sídle vám nespotřebovává tahy. Každého z hostů se můžete zeptat na tři věci: jaké má alibi, co ví o zbrani a poté na motiv jiného hosta. Na zemi se také povalují předměty, které mohou být vražednou zbraní a i možné důkazy (potvrzující jak alibi, tak také motiv). Každá tato akce způsobí, že se ručička hodin přiblíží k době, kdy přijede policie. V ten okamžik vám případ vezmou z rukou a vy jste pohořeli. To stejné se stane i pokud obviníte nevinného - přijede policie a vezme vám případ z vašich rukou.

Kromě tohoto konce tu jsou ještě další dva. Dobré je, že někdy můžete mít i více, než dvacet tahů. Je to vždy o náhodě, zda je policie opravdu dochvilná. Pozor si také musíte dávat na vraha, který během oné noci může zavraždit nejen další hosty, ale i dokonce vás!

[h1]To je vražda, suše oznámil[/h1]
K dispozici máte 12 různých scénářů, jejichž obtížnost postupně stoupá. Hra vás učí novým technikám vyšetřování, kdy vám zpočátku vraha předsune s vaší minimální snahou. Později si už budete muset i psát věci na papír, jelikož dojde například na to, kdo držel zbraň poslední, kdo byl poslední v místnosti s obětí atp. Dojde i na takové lahůdky, kdy třeba zjistíte, že vrahem je levák nebo že oběť byla zabita v uzamčené místnosti. Dokonce tu je i přítomnost křivého svědectví. Zkrátka a dobře, vyšetřovací činnost je parádní, zvládnutá na jedničku.

Některé postavy se s vámi dokonce odmítnou bavit a odejdou pryč, poté je musíte nahánět a i když se vám z nich podaří vymámit odpověď, vypotřebovali jste třeba 4 tahy. A to jde opravdu poznat. Vaším hlavním cílem je zjistit správně tři věci: kdo je vrahem, čím byla oběť zabita a motiv.

V drtivé většině případů se budete spoléhat na informace od hostů, například motiv zjistíte většinou tak, že vám nějaká osoba řekne drby o druhé postavě. Je trochu škoda, že tu více nelžou, ale poté by hra byla o dost těžší.

[h1]Jak jsem poznal vraha[/h1]
Každý z případů je dlouhý kolem 5-10 minut. Ano, je to tak. Tahle hra je spíše taková jednohubka. Díky tomu ji můžete dohrát za jeden večer a i když si u ní užijete hodně zábavy, nemůžu se ubránit dojmu, že to je málo. Naštěstí je zde aspoň útěcha ve dvou dalších věcech, díky kterým zde strávíte o několik hodin více. Nejprve to je generátor případů. Zatímco u klasických scénářů se nemění povaha případů, ale jen postavy a vrah (celkem tu je 15 druhů postav, které si mimochodem můžete pojmenovat jak chcete...), zde se vše míchá dohromady. Případy jsou tedy o něco těžší, musíte dávat pozor a pečlivě si i další věci zapisovat. Každá informace se vám zapíše i do vašeho deníčku ve hře, ale papír je papír.

Poté tu je možnost hrát hru v tzv. Master Detective módu. To je pro opravdové fajnšmekry, jelikož nejde o nic jiného, než zmenšení počtu tahů v případech. A to na rovných deset. Tenhle mód jsem jen letmo zkusil, jelikož je opravdu těžký a za deset tahů nejde pomalu nic zjistit... Tato obtížnost se vztahuje jak na základní případy, tak i na ty generované.

[h1]Nadšení z vraždy[/h1]
Nakonec bych se chtěl zmínit o grafice a hudbě. Právě grafická stránka hry bylo to, co mě nejvíce odpuzovalo. A Matter of Murder vypadá, jako by ji kreslilo šestileté dítě. Zpočátku se mi to nelíbilo, ale po pár minutách jsem si zvykl a už jsem to ani nevnímal. Co se týče hudby, je tu jen jedna jediná skladba. Tohle by byl logicky velký zápor, jenže je sama o sobě úžasná a dokáže navodit tu tajemnou a i trochu vtipnou atmosféru.

Ano, hra nabízí pár vtipů, kdy poukazuje na to, že hlavní hrdina je celý natěšený na řešení vraždy a že je to vlastně dobrá věc, která oživí (...) tento večer. Rozhraní hry je přehledné, nemám k němu žádné výhrady, máte tu hezký přehled podezřelých, zbraní a taktéž motivů, kde si je můžete postupně škrtat. Deník je velmi užitečný a u mapy mi snad vadí jen to, že nemáte zaznamenáno, kde se nachází oběť. Jelikož vás ale procházení panství nestojí ani jeden tah, je to jen menší nedostatek.

Na konec se vždycky podívám na cenu a zde tomu nebude jinak. U hry jsem strávil deset hodin a velmi si ji užil. Kolem tří hodin jsem řešil základní případy, zbytek pak byly ty generované. Cena tři eura se mi teda zdá opodstatněná.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ jednoduchá a zábavná hratelnost
+ humor
+ audiovizuální zpracování
+ případy jsou občas dost složité
+ generátor případů
+ nízká cena

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- v určitých aspektech by hra mohla být těžší
- pro některé délka případů, ale dle mě je to v pořádku

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 8/10[/b]

A Matter of Murder je zábavná hříčka, která potěší všechny milovníky detektivek a logiky. Pokud u her rádi přemýšlíte, koupí tohohle titulu neprohloupíte. Čeká tu na vás dvanáct jedinečných případů a pokud vám to je málo, můžete se vrhnout na ty generované, jež jsou ještě složitější.

review:

あなたはお祭り気分に浸りながらチャールズ・ディケンズの「クリスマスキャロル」を読みふけっていましたが、こっちの小さな謎解きのほうが時間潰しにぴったりでしょう？

犯人を逃してはなりませんよ！[/quote]

殺人事件の舞台となった邸宅を歩き回り、登場人物たちから「自身のアリバイ」「犯行に使われた凶器」「犯人の動機」を聞き出し、矛盾を見つけて真犯人を当てよう。

用意されている12のケースはバラエティに富んでいて、犯人を確定させる方法も様々。
短編推理小説を読んでいる気分になってとても面白い。

author: {'steamid': '76561198155448586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1572733266}
review: Fantastic, good stories despite being randomly generated, makes you really have to put together clues which could be as simple as a shirt stain. What would be great is if you can create your own cases, with your own writing and maybe your own characters. My only problem is that the cases get a little repetitive, and I would LOVE a creat your own case feature so you can share csses with friends. 8.5/10, worth the measly $3.

review:
A hidden gem of a game.
I'm a big fan of logic and deduction games like Clue and Whodunnit, but sadly not a lot of friends share my enthusiasm.

This game takes it up a notch with procedurally-generated mysteries so every playthrough is different.
Add in the visual style, which is reminiscent of the Edward Gorey intros to PBS' Mystery... and you have a winner.

Only thing it lacks is a fitting piano or organ score soundtrack, but that's easily remedied by popping on some music in the background.

I actually discovered Matter of Murder in the Android Market when looking at similar games to another game... read a review that mentioned Jessa's youtube video... went to check it out and then came looking on Steam for it.
Glad I did.
Very nice game.

review:
I love this game!... I've been looking for a Clue/Cluedo like mystery game with randomly generated cases; I found that in this game!.... If you're a fan of Clue/Cluedo and you know who Agatha Christie is or you like to watch Masterpieces Theater, you'll get a lot of added fun to this game. Don't let the art work fool you, in my opion the art work adds to the charm of the agme, I love it, it's both humorist and detailed, if you look hard enough.

Solving the murder cases is fun, but it would be nice to solve other cases as well, like robber, arisen, Capers, black mail (that doesn't lead to murder), it would be cool if they added that in some dlc or something, but if they don't, that's cool, cause it's one of the best games you'll find in this genre. You can't beat that 2.99 price either. I would have paid 5.99 for this game to be honest.

Well done to everyone responsible for making this game. It's a true gem. Thank you :)

review: I bought this game quite recently, I'm still atempting to get the achievements. What intrigued me the most about this game was the fact that it has a sense of mystery to it, there's no way you'd know the answer until you find out some clues! Even if you don't get the right answer for a level, you can start over and get a whole new scenario. The concept of "who done it" is something I enjoy, "A Matter of Murder" provides that for the gamer/viewer. This game tests your observational skills, logical skills, and patience. I really do recommend this game, espically with a price like that!

review:
This is a very fun murder mystery game, following the trope format of Agatha Christie and Sherlock Holmes stories.

Each short 10-minute episode (which is procedurally generated on the fly, giving a different game each time) is a fun little logic puzzle, with whimsical and charming English humor. The graphics style is unique, but certainly fits the type and tone of the game.

After a while, you'll start recognize the specific types of puzzles and will immediately remember how to solve them (but you still need to pull it off), so I hope that future updates will add to the diversity of the puzzles.

But for only 3 bucks, this is a game that every murder-mystery fan should own.

review:
I've got about an hour into this one. I like it though, and here's why:

I've been a gamer for a lot of years. It all started with games on a Texas Instruments computer back in the early '80s with such gems as Parsec and Hunt the Wumpus (not sarcasm, they WERE gems).

Shortly thereafter Atari showed up along with Windows 3.1 and MS-DOS.

Speaking of MS-DOS, here is where the relevancy to A Matter of Murder comes in.

Back around then, I first played a game that used ASCI graphics called Sleuth. You roam a mansion examining possible weapons and question suspects until you solve it or get killed. This game is very similar to Sleuth except this one has graphics, sound, and music.

You play as a budding detective in a typical British manor type setting with your usual suspects, various lords and ladies, an explorer, a couple foreigners, a veteran of the war, and a maid thrown together. One of them is murdered and it is up to you to point the finger at the culprit and say why it was done and with what weapon.

You have a time limit though and you lose a bit of time whenever you ask a suspect a question or examine a nearby weapon. Once you've ferreted out everyones alibis and motives and have found the weapon, you hit the accuse button and hope you're right.

As the cases get solved the next ones become harder. Alibis become more challenging to figure out, as do motives. You also have to rely on what the suspects say about the wound on the body to figure out the weapon instead of just being told that the poker has blood on it. The logic gets amped up pretty steeply after a few cases so it might help to have your own pen and pad handy as the in game notebook resembles a Clue sheet and doesn't have any space for notes of your own.

If you get tired of the names of the characters, you can change them into friends of yours. That's a nice little feature which Sleuth also had way back then.

This isn't a AAA game by any stretch of the imagination, but it is a fun little time waster for when you only have a little time to waste.

review:
If you like to feel like a right ol' clever clogs, then coming back to A Matter of Murder may prop up your confidence in that ol' noggin. Why? Because, once you've learned the individual gimmicks via the story chapters, you can hit that "Generate case" button, and get the satisfaction of not only solving mysteries in a limited space of time (Good on you!), but being enough of a smart cookie to work out *which* gimmicks are being used (Sometimes, there's more than one), and avoiding Red Herrings.

Even better, since individual mysteries take between five and ten minutes each? You can keep trying to solve them until you solve one and feel good about yourself for doing so. It's pretty accessible, it's simple to learn, but hard to play perfectly each time, and it's understated, murder mystery fun.
